required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of High Intensity Interval Training in a Hyperoxic-hyperbaric Environment on Exercise Performance at Altitude

brief_summary.textblock:
This study seeks to examine the effectiveness of training while in a hyperoxic-hyperbaric environment for exercise performance at altitude. Subjects will complete a short, high-intensity interval training (HIT) program inside the hyperbaric chamber.Before and after this training phase, all subjects will be tested for maximum aerobic capacity at a simulated high altitude of 15,000ft in a hypobaric chamber, as well as for molecular markers of mitochondrial oxidative capacity in a skeletal muscle biopsy.
A group of individuals of similar characteristics completing this training program in a normoxic-normobaric environment will serve as a control.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Lack of funding required to enroll target subject number

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Maximum Aerobic Capacity (VO2max) From Baseline to Post-training (< 72 Hours )
primary_outcome.description: Graded exercise test to exhaustion at simulated 15000 ft altitude

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Ventilatory Threshold (VT) From Baseline to Post-training (<72 Hours)
primary_outcome.description: Graded exercise test to exhaustion at simulated 15000 ft altitude
Immunofluorescence microscopy using citrate synthase staining

primary_outcome.measure: Pgc-1a Coactivator Muscle Protein Content Change

primary_outcome.description: Immunofluorescence microscopy using citrate synthase staining

arm_group.description: Hyperoxic hyperbaric interval exercise training Six sessions of 30 min.of High-intensity interval training completed on a 3-times a week basis at 1.4 ATA of oxygen in a hyperbaric chamber.
Normoxic, normobaric, interval exercise training Six sessions of 30 min.of High-intensity interval training completed on a 3-times a week basis.

intervention.description: Six 30-min high-intensity interval training sessions completed 3-times a week while at 1.4 ATA of oxygen in a hyperbaric chamber.
Six 30-min high-intensity interval training sessions completed 3-times a week.
Used in Hyperoxic hyperbaric interval exercise training intervention

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy, recreationally active or sedentary individuals
Exclusion Criteria:
- VO2max < 35 ml/kg/min - male 30 ml/kg/min - female
- chronic cardiovascular or pulmonary diseases
- history of pneumothorax
- active smoker
- pregnant women
- non-english speaking
- not in full mental capacity
- blind
- sickle cell trait or disease

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 25 participants were consented. 21 were randomized and completed the study, 1 was a screen failure, 1 withdrew after the initial biopsy and rash from bandage adhesive, 1 was withdrawn due to schedule noncompliance, and one was withdrawn after a syncopal episode during the initial biopsy.

event.description: Dizziness resulting from hypoxemia due to exposure to high altitude, 15,000'.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
